data.title: The Software Revolution
data.meta_description:
The Software Revolution - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. - The Internet and World Wide Web are enabling a new economic model for the software industry by allowing "mini-programs" or "applets" to be distributed over the web rather than traditional large bundled software packages. This threatens the prevailing business model of companies like Microsoft and Intel who benefit from bundled software and continual hardware upgrades. 
- A new programming language called Java allows small programs called "applets" to run on any device that has a Java enabled web browser, potentially ending software lock-in to specific hardware/operating systems and making bloatware obsolete. Many see Java and the ability to distribute software over the web as ushering in a new era for the software industry.
